question.text: In redox reaction, <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> oxidises <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>[</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></math> into <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo></mrow></msubsup></math> ions in acidic medium, than how many moles of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> will react with <math><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi></math> of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>[</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></math>

options.text: <math><mn>5 </mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math><mn>9 </mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math><mn>8 </mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math><mn>30.5 </mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

solution.text:
n-factor of H2O2=2

n-factor of K4[Fe(CN)6]=61

∵mole of H2O21 mole of K4Fe(CN)6=612

∴  mole of H2O2=612×1=30.5
